div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division

p.add: In Re application of F. S. Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

figure.p: Filed In The U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division Sep301915 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk By Ed. M Lakin deputy 2x

div1.p: Geo. D. Emery Attorney for appellant
At which office they consent that serivce of all subsequent papers, except writs and processes, may be made upon them
Service of within Assignment this 30th day of Sept1915 and recepit of a copy thereof, admitted, Frank P. Helsell Attorneys for resp.
In the United States District Court For The Western District of Washinton, Northern Division
In the Matter of the application of Francis Stephen Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

At a stated Term of the Unitd States District court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, held at the court room in the city of Seattle King County, Washington, on the 30thday of September A. D. 1915,
Present: The Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, District Judge for said District;
On motion of Geo. D. Emery Esq., solicitor and counsel for the Petitioner, appellant, IT IS ORDERED:

That an appeal to the Supreme Court of the United States from the final order, decision and judgment heretofore filed and entered herein, be, and the same is hereby allowed, and that a certified transcript of the record, exhibits and all proceedings herein be forthwith transmitted to said United States Supreme Court.
It is further ordered that the bond on appeal be fixed at the sum of two hundred fiftydollars; words crosed out
Dated September 30thA.D. 1915. Jeremiah Neterer District Judge.
